intro: Epilobium anagallidifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, pink to reddish-purple, and are borne in clusters at the leaf axils. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
